dt: {bc}easy to speak to or deal with

dt.t: information that should be {wi}accessible{/wi} to everyone
people who are {wi}accessible{/wi} to new ideas

dt: {bc}easily used or accessed by people with disabilities {bc}adapted for use by people with disabilities

dt.t: Councilwoman Deborah Gross introduced legislation Tuesday that would prioritize {wi}accessible{/wi} entryways, common areas, restrooms and communications facilities—in that order—when city businesses undergo major physical updates.

et: Middle English {it}accessyble{/it}, borrowed from Middle French & Late Latin; Middle French {it}accessible{/it}, borrowed from Late Latin {it}accessibilis{/it}, from Latin {it}accessus{/it} (past participle of {it}accēdere{/it} "to approach") + {it}-ibilis{/it} {et_link|-ible|-able} {ma}{mat|accede|}{/ma}
shortdef: capable of being reached; also : being within reach
easy to speak to or deal with
capable of being used or seen : available
